content: "http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/8028174.stm" Switzerland's largest bank, UBS, has asked a US court not to go ahead with a tax case involving more than 50,000 US customers with Swiss accounts. The Internal Revenue Service, which administers tax in the US, has taken out a civil suit to force UBS to reveal the identities of 52,000 American customers suspected of holding accounts totalling $14.8bn

content: The Swiss manufactured NAZI armaments during WW2 and exchanged looted gold and gems that allowed the NAZI's to but raw materials for their war, and because of the Swiss the WW2 was prolonged by several years. The Swiss stored and now refuse to give back art looted by the NAZI's. The Swiss stole money and valuables from thousands of Jews who put in their banks for safe keeping during WW2, and reuse to return it to their heirs. The country of Switzerland is a corporation and is run as such, and they are not nice people. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson

content: quote: I thought you stash your illegal wealth in Ukraine? I didn't know you used the Swiss. Well Flanker, apparently most of this money accumulated under the tax system of your hero, President Bush - So these guys are what we in America call common criminals. And apparently they steal more money then the Somali Pirates. I'm surprised you don't advocate bombing the Swiss... Big Grin WHere I keep my retirement funds is none of your damn business but you can be guaranteed Im only getting taxed one time when it is made and wont get caught up by YOUR hero's idea of taxing wealth. Most of that money was in those accounts during Clinton's terms, its not something that came up all of the sudden. No one is doing anything illegal. All of that money has had the legitimately due taxes paid on it. The USA doesnt deserve to get to tax that money over and over and over and over again simply because its a good source to steal money from. Again its that idea that the US is the world's policeman and should get a chunk of any money made anywhere in the world because no one can stop them.(well except Chinese held cash) The Swiss are quite far from morally bankrupt. I think its far worse to continually print money because you cant even get enough people to buy bonds to cover the massive 3 billion per day of debt additions to that already 10 trillion of existing debt. But hey, I guess its fine by you to essentially commit financial and economic fraud against your citizens whose great, great grandkids will be struggling to pay the interest on a debt that makes up 70% of the federal budget. Im glad to understand that a few billion dollars held by 50,000 people that has already had taxes paid on is more morally bankrupt than tens of trillions of generational debt passed on to people who got absolutely no say in being born with a tax burden of nearly a million bucks each by 2012

content: This isJudge Learned Hand's famous statement on taxes: "Anyone may arrange his affairs so that his taxes shall be as low as possible; he is not bound to choose that pattern which best pays the treasury. There is not even a patriotic duty to increase one's taxes. Over and over again the Courts have said that there is nothing sinister in so arranging affairs as to keep taxes as low as possible. Everyone does it, rich and poor alike and all do right, for nobody owes any public duty to pay more than the law demands." It is implicit therefor, that after arranging one's tax affairs properly one pay his taxes. I would like to see the US Congress pass a law that substantially increases prison time for any citizen or resident alien who hides his or her money in Switzerland or any other tax haven. Such a measure would "bring" the money back here post haste since there is no better country in which to live than the USA.

content: When you utilize the resources of this country to make money it is your responsibility to pay taxes on that money deemed necessary by the government to support that infrastructure that allowed you to make said money. Too many have avoided paying what the government has deemed necessary by hiding their income outside of the U.S. Change that is actually worth something. Of all escape mechanisms, Death is the most efficient. ~~ H.L. Mencken

content: quote: Originally posted by mmulder67: Had the individuals and corporations in question paid their share of taxes on all their income we might possibly not be in the deficit situation we are in now. Did that ever occur to you? Come on. Examine the numbers. Whatever hidden taxes there have been cannot come near the national debt. Excessive spending--so much in the name of alligator tear "compassion" to fight poverty for victims (and provide all sorts of other unearned handouts) whose numbers only expand from the moral hazard--has screwed us and the unborn of this nation, if this nation can exist economically and otherwise long enough for them to be born and grow. And let us never forget that Obama's chief lawyer, Holder, went out of his way to let Marc Rich off the hook and get a pardon, once his wife contributed handsomely to Bill Clinton's fund. And Obama's great SecTreas and assorted other nominees never paid their just taxes. Enough of the leftist hypocrisy. Probably the most important stricture for leadership is to lead by force of personal example; the Obama administration which now complains about overseas accounts fails miserably in the most important measure of leadership.
